headline.main: RUSSIANS FAR WEST OF SEALED CRIMEA; TAKE DNIEPER CITY; Tolbukhin Reaches Black Sea Beyond Perekop While Other Forces Mass on River KERCH LANDING REPORTED Nazis Hold Out at Krivoi Rog -- Strategic Height Captured in Battle for Vitebsk RED ARMY AT COAST FAR PAST CRIMEA

lead_paragraph: LONDON, Wednesday, Nov. 3 -- Gen. Fedor I. Tolbukhin's Fourth Ukraine Army yesterday captured the historic city of Kakhovka, where thousands of Germans drowned in the swirling Dnieper or died under murderous Russian fire as they attempted to flee to the west bank of the river.
abstract: USSR forces take Kakhovka; take Skadovsk, threatening Kherson and Nikolayev; take strategic height, Vitebsk front; reptd landing north and south of Kerch; Gers deny Crimea evacuation; USSR repts contact lost between enemy units fleeing between Dnieper and Black Sea coast; map
snippet: LONDON, Wednesday, Nov. 3 -- Gen. Fedor I. Tolbukhin's Fourth Ukraine Army yesterday captured the historic city of Kakhovka, where thousands of Germans drowned in the swirling Dnieper or died under murderous Russian fire as they attempted to flee ...
